page.title: 18The Boat Inn, Erbistock
page.content: The Boat Inn is a 16th century building sited on the banks of the River Dee.The Inn has got some lounges with open log fires.The restaurant has got oak beams and is quite comfortable.Some people choose to eat outside by the river.Some food specialities are local salmon,pheasant and lamb.The Inn is open from 12.30 pm to 3.00 pm and from 5.30 pm to 11.30 pm.To local people the Boat is a pub where you can sit and chat with your friends,and to tourists it is a pub and a restaurant attracting people at weekends from a radius of 40 miles. The Inn is built by the site of an historic ford and used to be an important crossing place of the River Dee.The ford and ferry are no longer used and people cross the river by bridge at Overton.
